description: This wiki page is a stub. Hit the edit button above to add to this article.
name: The Fire Next Time...
The Fire Next Time... Chapter Two
The Fire Next Time... Chapter Three

description: Electra tries to keep Wolverine's mind on the war of the warrior instead of where it's going down; the mindless rage of the beast. They have talks and confrontaions through the restraunt near the top of one of the World Trade Center towers. She runs off and Wolverine is forced to use his mind instead of his powers to figure out where she went. In another sword battle, Wolverine uses his ninjitsu training to sheathe his sword in her scabbard, which pleases them both.
name: Top of the World, Ma!

description:
The origin of Onslaught revealed! How is it that Professor X became host of this dangerous psychic entity? And how was Magneto involved in the transfer? All is explained through Wolverine’s flashbacks, and first-hand narrative, in this Onslaught-centric issue.

Wolverine has been facing his inner beastiality, with Elektra´s help he´s looking for his own future. Seeking the advice of Gateway Wolverine would find some of the most stunning answers of his entire life.

The mystery of the origin of Onslaught has revealed!
name: Onslaught Impact 1: The Emperor Of The Realm Of Grief

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Reeling from the Onslaught attack, Logan retreats from the main battlefield to aid those who are unable to defend themselves. But wherever Wolverine goes, a ghost from his past isn’t far behind. Enter Elektra’s old guru, Stick, who has returned to give Wolverine a lesson in humanity.
name: Onslaught Impact 2: Faces In The Fire

description:
Accompanied by Elektra, Logan treks to the remains of his cabin in the Canadian Rockies, making his annual pilgrimage to the grave of his lover, Silver Fox.

Afterwards, the pair fly to Greece, to visit Elektra's childhood home. Relaxing on the villa's veranda, Stavros, head of the household staff, tells Logan he reminds him of a Canadian soldier he met during World War II. Stavros relates the tale: learning of his mother's death at the hands of the Nazis, he sought revenge, and was persuaded by the soldier that stealth, and a silent dagger, would increase their chance of success. Although they had wiped out the Nazis in the compound, the colonel who ordered the murder was not present. Stavros says he kept the soldier's dagger.

Stavros then tells Elektra he knows the whereabouts of the last of the assassins that killed her father. If she says the word, he will have the killer, Sawyer, eliminated. Elektra forbids it, so that evening, Stavros and his men release Sawyer from the wine cellar where he's been held. Intending to alert the authorities about his wrongful imprisonment, Sawyer runs into Logan, who forcefully warns him against doing so. Stavros later regards the dagger he's kept for so long; its sheath is inscribed with the name "CPL. LOGAN".
name: Openings and Closures

description:
In Tokyo, Logan visits the home of his ward Amiko and her guardian Yukio. As a noodle vendor outside reports Logan's moves, the mutant senses something wrong and finds himself ambushed by ninjas of the Hand. After dispatching the warriors, Logan comes under fire by an armored police unit. He steals a neighbor's motorcycle, then evades the police. Elsewhere, Akatora, leader of the Hand, receives a report of these events.

Logan bursts into a Yakuza-run casino requesting sanctuary, based on his association with the Yashida clan. The Oyabun there, Pale Flower, agrees to hear Logan's tale.

Meanwhile, in his fortress where Yukio is held in a dungeon, Akatora reviews the progress of Amiko's indoctrination as she plied with sweets and toys. He then gets a report on Logan's whereabouts.

At the casino, in an attempt at revenge for her father's death years ago, Pale Flower unsuccessfully poisons Logan, moments before the armored police raid the casino.

[Dedicated to the Memory of Mark Gruenwald.]
name: Once Upon a Time in Little Tokyo

description:
Locked up in a Tokyo jail, Logan and Pale Flower watch as the Iron Monk appears, then subdues the guards. Released from their cells, Logan and Pale Flower, fight a futile battle against the Monk. Yohei, an enforcer of the Silver Samurai, emerges from a hidden panel in the jail floor to deliver the Honor Sword of the Yashida Clan to Logan, who runs the Iron Monk through with the blade. Yohei leads Logan and Pale Flower out of the jail.

At Akatora's fortress, where Yukio is imprisoned, and Amiko undergoes indoctrination, Akatora learns from the noodle vendor of Logan's escape, then assigns two of his enforcers to eliminate the vendor.

At a Tokyo waterfront, Logan tells his companions of his intent to rescue Yukio and Amiko. Yohei and Pale Flower insist on aiding him.

Akatora's enforcers return to his fortress, unsuccessful in their mission, upon which Akatora assembles his team of Cyber-Ninjas, whom he commands to kill the noodle vendor and Logan.
name: East is East...

description:
Logan finds the noodle vendor, an informant for the leader of the Hand, under attack by the Hand's Cyber-Ninjas, and offers his assistance in exchange for information on the whereabouts of the captive Yukio and Amiko.

In the fortress of Akatora, Amiko slowly succumbs to brainwashing, while outside, the crime boss films a giant monster movie in which he portrays the main creature. Wolverine arrives and is attacked by the other actors, Cyber-Ninjas whose monster costumes contain actual weaponry. Wolverine easily dispatches the ninjas, then confronts Akatora, while Pale Flower, Yohei and the vendor reach the beach by boat, guns blazing. The trio rescue Yukio and Amiko, then Akatora reveals that one of Wolverine's allies works for the Hand. The mutant then puts his sword through Yohei who dissolves; Wolverine had guessed from the scent on Yohei's dagger that he was the traitor. Akatora escapes.

As Wolverine rafts away from the fortress with his allies, Amiko smiles enigmatically.

In the Canadian woods, a foraging bear breaks open an ancient Indian pot releasing a spirit that possesses the animal. Elsewhere, Wolverine is assisting Shaman in tracking a violent pair of convenience store robbers. Wolverine confronts them as they terrorize a family on a camping trip, when the possessed bear also arrives.

As the crooks, the mother and her son escape in their Jeep, leaving the father behind, Wolverine battles the creature, trying to keep his animalistic nature from overcoming him. Sheathing his claws, he stuns the bear with a series of blows, allowing Shaman to recapture the spirit.

Meanwhile, having crashed the vehicle into a tree, the robbers threaten to kill the mother and her son, just as Wolverine arrives to subdue them.
name: Lesser Beasts

description:
After his adventures in Japan and Canada, Logan returns to the Xavier Institute for Higher Learning as the X-Men prepare a send-off for Bobby Drake, who is taking a leave of absense to be with his parents. During the gathering, a mysterious box arrives from Landau, Luckman and Lake for Logan's safekeeping. Later, at various locales, Logan reflects on recent events.

The next day, during a Danger Room workout, Wolverine encounters a slightly familiar horned, skull-faced entity that offers him a restored Mariko in exchange for a favor. Wolverine defeats the being with its own sword, then Stick appears, offering words of wisdom.

Later, Logan informs Sam Guthrie of his intention to move into the city.
name: Restoration

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
As he searches for an apartment in the East Village, Logan chases off a couple of thugs harrassing a woman, Kirstin, and her wheelchair-bound boyfriend, Clive. In thanks, she tells Logan the apartment next to theirs is available. Down the block, a mime is lured into a basement where he encounters a red-eyed being.

Logan checks in by phone with Jean Grey at Xavier's mansion, then meanders through his new neighborhood.

Some time later, Logan accepts a construction job from Helen Bach, a friend of Kirstin.

The workday done, Logan and Helen walk toward the apartment, when they see his motorcycle being vandalized the same two thugs from before, but this time, their eyes glow red. Logan and Helen overcome the pair, then Logan rolls his Harley into his apartment where he finds the possessed mime jugling knives.
name: The Light at the End of the Day

description:
As Logan prepares to fight the possessed knife-juggling mime he's found in his new apartment, the sight of the mysterious box he's safekeeping sparks a memory. He recalls when he was in Japanese-occupied China and encountered Imperial soldiers threatening an aged teacher and a young American wielding a staff. Logan's valor in defending the pair impressed Captain Ogun, who offered to teach Logan martial arts.

As the fight between Logan and the mime continues, Ororo Monroe and Jean Grey, arriving for a visit, join the fray. The entity possesses Jean, allowing the mime to escape. Jean repels the spirit, which then takes over Helen Bach's mind.

Through a mystic orb, these events are watched by Daimon Hellstorm.
name: The Wind From The East

description:
Wolverine tracks the person currently possessed by the entity that's been attacking him this evening, and learns from his neighbors that it is Helen Bach. In an alley, he finds Daimon Hellstrom who cryptically tells him to continue safegurding his mysterious box. As Hellstrom leaves, Wolverine is attacked by Lady Deathstrike, demanding the parcel. Wanting to get down to the mystery of the box, Wolverine and Deathstrike call a truce.

Back in Logan's apartment, Phoenix and Storm are mystified by the contents of the box, when the possessed Helen busts in, guns blazing. Phoenix counterattacks on the astral plane, freeing Helen from the entity's grasp, just as Wolverine and Deathstrike arrive. A tearful Helen relates her experience as a pilot captured during the Gulf War, and her attempts to cope with the trauma.

The entity, now recognized by Logan as Ogun, then possesses Deathstrike and she bursts from the apartment, vanishing into the night.
name: For the Snark Was a Roojum, You See!

description:
This issue was part of Marvel Comics' Flashback month.

The story begins with Logan talking to James and Heather Hudson at a time before he became an X-Man. They tell Logan that they have made an appointment for him with the doctor that invented the adamantium alloy. He goes there searching for answers about his adamantium skeleton and missing memories. When Logan gets there, what he finds instead are various spies and assassins there waiting for him, including Sabretooth, HYDRA, Nick Fury, and Carol Danvers. They have all tracked down Logan to either intercept him or kill him. Logan, unnerved that some of these strangers appear to know him, must fight off those that would do him harm, and help those that appear to be his allies, though he has no memory of any of them.
name: A Whiff Of Sartrés Madeleine!

description:
When the X-Men are taken prisoner by Zero Tolerance, it's up to an injured Wolverine to save the day!

The X-Men (Cyclops, Phoenix, Wolverine, Storm and Cannonball) have been captured by Zero Tolerance, and Bastion displays for the captive Jubilee a hologram showing the mutant prisoners being brought into the New Mexico base. Having jumped from a burning plane earlier, Wolverine lies deathly still and bloody, and his captors place him in an incinerator. The gas and flames revive him and he bursts free, overcoming the guards.

Wolverine frees the other X-Men, but, badly injured during their capture, they try to escape with minimal conflict. Using her psychic influence, Phoenix has teams of guards firing upon each other, as they make for the exit.

The main blast door resists their attempts to break through, and Bastion's troops close in on them. Jubilee, however, manages to slam her power dampening helmet against the controls, allowing her allies to slip out.

As the X-Men commandeer an aircraft, Wolverine hesitates a moment, sensing an ally within the base.
name: In the Face of It

description:
After the X-Men escape from Bastions base, Wolverine makes a huge discovery and reveals the secret of the Prime Sentinels!

Having escaped from Bastion's New Mexico base, the X-Men cross the desert sands till they reach a trailer encampment. They find one inhabitant, a former stunt pilot, nicknamed Mustang, who had lost the use of his eyes and legs in a crash. He and the other campers who reside there are patients of Dr. Prospero at a clinic nearby, where major injuries are healed.

They all bed down for the night, but once everyone is asleep, Logan heads to the clinic to check it out. The next morning, the others learn what Logan discovered: the clinic is repairing injuries with cybernetics, that transform the unwitting patients into Prime Sentinels under the control of Operation: Zero Tolerance.

Suddenly, OZT aircraft are seen approaching, as well as a busful of the camper returning from the clinic. Mustang hides the X-Men, as above, Bastion gives the command to activate those patient farthest along in the transformation, in case they are near any mutants. At the same time, Mustang warns his fellow patients about what he's learned.

In Washington, D. C., Senator Robert Kelly decides to pull support for Zero Tolerance, and contacts S.H.I.E.L.D.
name: What the Blind Man Saw

description:
When the X-Men realize that innocent people are being turned into Prime Sentinels, they take action. And finally--the return of Jubilee!

At the New Mexico encampment of Dr. Prospero's patients, who, unbeknownst to them, are being transformed into Prime Sentinels, the X-Men come under attack when three of the Sentinels are activated by the mutants' presence. The X-Men defeat their attackers, and determine they must destroy the 'clinic'.

With S.H.I.E.L.D. about to be activated against Zero Tolerance, Bastion contacts Dr. Prospero, and, gives the order to initiate the "Final Directive".

While the X-Men ready their assault on the 'clinic', Jubilee, having escaped the ZT base, runs through the desert, and up against a Sentinel. Wolverine, who had earlier caught her scent, arrives in time to save her.

The pair reach the 'clinic', where the partially successful attack reveals the personnel and most of the equipment have vanished.

Learning the X-Men have breached the facility, Bastion orders the activation of one last Prime Sentinel: the mutants' new friend, Mustang.
name: A Divine Image

description:
When the X-Men's newest friend gets activated as a Prime Sentinel, Wolverine decides the best thing to do is evacuate! But when Cyclops gets hit in the crossfire, we discover there may be a few casualties in this war.

In the New Mexico facility where Zero Tolerance once transformed unwilling humans into Prime Sentinels, the X-Men's new friend, Mustang, has just been activated as a Sentinel himself. A battle ensues, and Wolverine orders Cyclops and Cannonball to evacuate the people there, while he tries to reason with Mustang. The Sentinel programming is too overpowering, however, and Wolverine is reluctantly forced to fight. Jubilee, against her teammates wishes, run into the building and releases a blast of her fireworks in Mustang's face. Blinded again, Mustang regains his senses.

Outside, Zero Tolerance forces are retreating under fire from S.H.I.E.L.D. units. One stray Sentinel manages to blast Cyclops in the chest. S.H.I.E.L.D. medics treat Cyclops and their scanners find something implanted within his chest. Thinking the medlab at the Xavier Institute in his best hope, the X-Men commandeer a ZT transport. As they fly, Cyclops tells the others he thinks the device inside him may be a bomb.
name: Out of Darkness Into Light

description:
During time spent in Hong Kong ten years earlier, Logan had befriended a contract killer named McLeish, who was referred to by the locals as "White Ghost". One conversation between the two revolved around McLeish's lament about aging and losing his status as "the best killer in the world", as well as his musings how one might go about killing a man with a mutant healing ability and an adamantium skeleton..

At the time, Logan was seeing a young woman named Ai-Chia Wong, daughter of a local filmmaker who had long avoided dealings with the criminal triads. After a movie date, Logan escorted Ai-Chia to her home where they discovered her father had just been brutally murdered. Logan leapt onto his motorcycle and followed the fresh trail to a speeding Cadillac in which McLeish rode. The killer forced Logan to crash and made his getaway to meet his triad contact at a pier for the pay-off.

Logan tracked him there and launched his bike onto McLeish, breaking his back. The triad bagman then fired at Logan, but sparks from his gun set off the bike's leaking gasoline, causing the speedboat upon which the two criminals had stood to explode, apparently killing the pair.

In the present, Logan returns to his East Village apartment to find the bloodied body of a murdered acquaintance lying on his bed. He sees McLeish's distinctive dagger embedded in the top of his nightstand. He removes it, unwittingly releasing the trigger on a bomb hidden within the top drawer. Hearing the click, Logan leaps out his window to the street below. He realizes McLeish is alive and gunning for him.
name: Not Dead Yet - Part 1 of 4

description:
In New York's East Village, Logan is on the run from McLeish, a hit-man he thought he had killed ten years before, after McLeish killed the father of Logan's then-girlfriend, Ai-Chia Wong. He and McLeish had begun a friendship, but Logan lost his taste for the attitudes of the bloodthirsty killer.

An automobile crashes into Logan, pinning him between it and another car. The driver steps out and raises a pistol at Logan, saying that McLeish sends his regards. Despite his crushed legs and being repeatedly shot, Logan throttles the gunman into unconsiousness, then drags himself from the wreckage.

Once he recovers sufficiently from his injuries, Logan makes his way to the garage where he keeps his motorcycle. Sensing another assassin on the other side of the garage door, he disables the second gunman, knocking him out. Soon, Logan is on his bike, heading out of the city.

Elsewhere, in a group of run-down cabins in the woods, a sickly, shadowy figure awaits Logan's expected arrival.
name: Not Dead Yet - Part 2 of 4

description:
Ten years earlier, Logan made the acquaintance of the murder-mad contract killer McLeish, whom Logan thought he had killed in vengeance for the murder of his girlfriend's father. The relationship between Logan and his lady, Ai-Chia, ended shortly thereafter, with Logan unable to explain why he had been friendly with McLeish prior to her father's murder.

Now, Logan rides his motorcycle through the woods of New York as he attempts to evade the still-living McLeish's assassins. However, a squad of killers ambush him on the road. He makes short work of them, and determines that McLeish's intent is not to have him killed yet, but to herd him toward their final confrontation. Logan proceeds on foot in the direction he thinks he'll find McLeish. Soon, he comes upon a tape recorder with a message from the hit-man, and a booby trap which he narrowly avoids. Then Logan finds the body of Ai-Chia bound to the swinging plank that is part of the booby trap. Enraged, Logan runs further into the woods, vowing to kill McLeish.
name: Not Dead Yet - Part 3 of 4

description:
Logan runs through the wintry woods of New York toward a confrontation with the contract killer McLeish. He reaches the small village where McLeish is holed up, as the hitman activates floodlights and a loudspeaker to welcome his prey. The lights illuminate the strung up corpses of the village's inhabitants, all victims of McLeish. A misstep by Logan activates an explosive, knocking him back several yards. Logan recovers as McLeish goads him forward, explaining how he survived their last encounter when Logan thought the killer had perished.

Logan enters a cabin, but is ambushed by a gunman. He dodges the gunfire and knocks out the assassin. Proceeding further into the cabin, Logan finds, not McLeish, but a Chinese national who states he is the son of a Triad criminal Logan killed ten years earlier. The man claims McLeish is dead and threatens Logan with a pistol loaded with adamantium rounds, but the mutant buries his claws in the would-be killer's chest.

Logan then steps up to a closed door and tells McLeish to come out. Poison-coated adamantium bullets rip through the door and strike Logan, and the aged McLeish emerges. As McLeish stands over Logan gloating, Logan tells him he befriended him only out of pity, and that, as a Canadian agent, he had killed McLeish's son. Furious, McLeish closes in on Logan, allowing him to put his claws through the killer's throat.

Finally recovered, Logan sets fire to the cabin, and walks into the night.
name: Not Dead Yet - Part 4 of 4

description:
In a hidden bunker beneath a Greenwich Village warehouse, Logan is imprisoned by his enemies Roughouse and Bloodscream. He is suspended above the floor, his wrists bound by manacles supported by steel beams bolted to the walls. Periodically, Roughouse and Bloodscream enter the cell to torture Logan, in an effort to overtax his healing factor.

When his tormentors leave, Logan recalls the events that led to his predicament. After deciding that his bombed-out apartment wasn't worth salvaging, he walked to the neighborhood grocery for some lunch. There, we came upon a thug demanding protection money from the owner. Logan did not interfere, but instead, tracked the bagman to the warehouse, where he was ambushed by Roughouse.

After another beating from Roughouse, Bloodscream reveals that they are working for someone called Black Tarantula. Once the villains leave, Logan begins his escape. He deliberately breaks nearly every bone in his left forearm and wrist until he can extract his bloody limb. Using a lock pick he had hidden in the heel of his boot, he releases his other arm.

Within their office, Bloodscream and Roughouse decide to kill Logan. As the muscle man approaches the door, a forklift driven by Logan plows through, striking Roughhouse. They exchange blows until Bloodscream enters the fray, causing Logan to bleed profusely. Logan slams his claws through Bloodscream's chest, forcing him to flee. Then Logan evades Roughouse, tricking the big man into shattering a pair of concrete supports, causing a collapse which buries Roughhouse under a pile of rubble. The villain rises from the wreckage, but Logan holds his fist to Roughouse's throat, threatening to pop his claws. The muscle man surrenders. As the police take Roughouse into custody, Logan strolls away, pondering his quest to determine just what it is that he "is the best at."
name: Better Than Best!

description:
After going through a sparring session in an effort to hone his dulled fighting skills, Logan walks through the streets of New York. Passing by Madison Square Garden, where Captain America is about to make an appearance at a charity benefit, Logan senses something amiss. Sneaking into a rear entrance, he evades a security guard. Reacting to his instincts, Logan slashes the air with his claws, throwing bystanders into a panic. Unseen enemies strike back at him.

Then Captain America enters the scene and Logan leaps toward him, claws extended. Cap dodges Logan who succeeds in injuring his real target, another invisible assailant. Taking specialized goggles from his fallen foe and putting them on, Logan finally is able to see his invisible enemies, a costumed gang. Their leader, who calls himself Rascal, is out to build a reputation by assassinating Captain America. Logan lays into them, and he manages to wrest another set of googles which he tosses to the Avenger. Captain America joins in, and the battle spills onto the stage, where the cheering audience believes the show has begun.

Logan and Cap subdue their foes, and Rascal tries to escape, but the X-Man corners him. The would-be assassin threatens to detonate an explosive device in his costume, but Captain America knocks him out with his shield, and the audience goes wild.
name: Invisible Destroyers!

description:
Jubilation Lee (Jubilee) is having a nightmare in which she is being chased down a Chicago alleyway [in a scene reminiscent of Kitty Pryde being pursued in Uncanny X-Men #131]. Then her dream places her in the Australian outback to relive her first meeting with, and rescue of, Wolverine who had been left to die by the Reavers. The pair are trailed by Phoenix, Psylocke, Rogue, Jessica Drew (Spider-Woman) and Tyger Tiger, all are dressed in green variations of their outfits. Jubilee and Wolverine are cornered by Rogue and Yukio, also clad in green.

Jubilee is then pulled from both her dream and her room at the Massachusetts Academy by Shadowcat (Kitty, accompanied by her pet dragon Lockheed) who explains that the terrorist Viper is using a chemical to control the women Jubilee saw in her nightmare. Something about Kitty's phasing ability makes her less susceptible to the brainwashing.

They are found by Phoenix and Rogue, so Jubilee calls out to Gateway (the Aboriginal teleporter), who draws them to the outback. After having had a little time to catch their breath, they begin a world-wide search for Logan. Their first stop is the Alaskan mining town where Logan once lived with Silver Fox, but they are soon found by the mind-controlled Rogue and Tyger. Kitty subdues Rogue, but then Tyger shoots her with a weapon that fires a substance which encases Kitty so she cannot phase or move. Lockheed breathes fire at the Rogue and Tyger, allowing Jubilee to call out to Gateway who opens a portal for Lockheed to haul her and Kitty to safety.

They find themselves in Japan at Agarashima, the seat of Clan Yashida. Logan greets them at the door, but they are immediately accosted by Yukio. He defends them against her, but is taken out by Psylocke's psychic knife. Logan then experiences dreams about the women in his life: first they appear as serpents, then he relives the murder of Silver Fox at Sabretooth's hand, as well as Mariko Yashida's death.

He awakens to find himself, Jubilee and Kitty in Tyger's quarters in Madripoor, in the company of Viper and her thralls. Suddenly, Black Widow bursts in to take on the terrorist and the brainwashed women, allowing Jubilee to generate fireworks which free Kitty from the shell she's encased in. A battle ensues and Viper decides to flee, freeing Phoenix from her control. She clears up the other's minds as Logan chases Viper. He fights with her, while she holds back, insisting that he "remember his vow", but he is in a berserker rage that doesn't end until Jubilee intervenes.

With everything calming down, Logan puts his arm around Viper and announces to the stunned assemblage that she is his wife.
name: Logan's Run!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
On the grounds of the palace of the late Ruling Prince of Madripoor, Sabretooth stands triumphant, having just defeated Logan (Wolverine) and Kitty Pryde (Shadowcat) on the day of Logan’s obligatory wedding to the Viper. He then ponders how best to make use of Kitty, while during the fracas, Viper had vanished.

Near the waterfront of the Lowtown of Madripoor, a combined force of Hydra soldiers and Hand ninjas execute their mission, part of a plan to destabilize the island nation. The unlikely allies debate the merits of their respective methods, when a shield-slinging combatant stirkes from the shadows, taking them out one by one. They think their assailant is Captain America until his ‘shield’ lands in the light, where they can see it is merely a trash can lid. In desperation, the last Hydra grunt standing detonates an explosive, setting the area on fire.

Soon, Wolverine emerges from the bay a mile from the conflagration where he had just confronted the enemy cadre, hoping he had successfully planted in their minds the thought that the Avengers may be in the vicinity.

Anchored in the harbor, a derelict oil tanker acts as a hidden base for Hydra and the Hand. Aboard, the commander discusses with Matsuo Tsurayaba, Jonin of the Hand, their plan to jointly take control of the island by force. They also express concern that they may have caught the attention of the Avengers and that the Hulk may be in Madripoor as well.

In actuality, Wolverine is continuing his campaign of trickery against the insurgents. He intends to keep his foes off-balance using weapons and special effects gear to emulate the Hulk as well as members of the Fantastic Four and the X-Men in his attacks on the soldiers and the ninjas.

Meanwhile, in a Hihghtown skyscraper, a ganglord’s party is interrupted by Sabretooth and Shadowcat. The gangster, Bao Tien, is cornered by Shadowcat, who extracts from him the whereabouts of the Viper (who came to him, but whom he’d betrayed to the Hand) and the hidden Hydra base. She relays the information to Sabretooth, also asking why he’s helping her to find Viper. He replies it’s for the fun of it, as well as the fact he prefers that Madripoor not fall under Hydra’s control.

Wolverine makes his deceptive assault on the Hydra/Hand troops. Afterwards, from a rooftop, Logan assesses the results of his subterfuge and discusses with Police Chief Tai the need for Madripoor to have a strong leader respected by all factions. They agree Viper would fit the bill, but Tai laments she’s rumored to be a prisoner. Logan assures him that won’t last.

Later, Wolverine tracks the retreating soldiers and ninjas to the tanker. Once aboard, he recognizes Sabretooth’s scent and lunges to attack, but is surprised to see Shadowcat at his side, working with him. Sabretooth tells Wolverine he is fully aware they’ve entered a trap, which is sprung moments later. The floor falls away and they plummet into the ship’s hold, their powers now neutralized.

Matsuo and the Hydra commander observe the capture on their monitors. The commander insists the mutants should be killed, but Matsuo says he plans to enslave them.
name: I'm King Of The World!

description:
Anchored in Madripoor Harbor is a derelict oil freighter that houses the secret base of a combined force of Hydra and the Hand. Searching for the Viper on board, Wolverine, Sabretooth and Shadowcat have knowingly walked into a trap and are now the unconscious captives of the villains who intend to take control of the island.

Encircling the trio are dozens of the Hands sorcerers, ordered by their Jonin, Matsuo Tsurayaba, to work their magic to claim the souls of the mutants, enslaving them. The Hydra commander protests, insisting their enemies are too dangerous to leave alive.

As the mystics twist the psyches of the three, Shadowcat has a vision in which she savagely attacks Wolverine and Sabretooth, while in Logan's hallucination, he is a new student at Xavier's School for Gifted Children, but instead of being welcomed by the X-Men, he is mercilessly attacked by them.

With his warnings ignored, the Hydra commander returns to the area of the base where his team has held captive Tyger Tiger, Viper and Jessica Drew. His scientists are in the process of rewiring the women's minds, making them loyal to Hydra.

Due to his strong will, Sabretooth resists, freeing his temporary allies from their nightmares. Shadowcat frees Viper and relentlessly attacks the Hydra forces. She is about to kill the commander, when she succumbs to one of Viper's poisons. Elsewhere, Wolverine, who, in his fever dream, had fought back and defeated his friends, comes to to find that in reality, he has beaten all the sorcerers. He then turns against Sabretooth.

As Wolverine and Sabretooth brawl, they begin to realize their personalities are not quite what they had been: due to the magic used against them: Wolverine has Shadowcat's innocence, while Sabertooth deals with a conscience based on Wolverine's sense of honor. Logan suspects Shadowcat has Sabertooth's rage and bloodlust.

Matsuo surveys the scene of the defeated sorcerers and vows a final reckoning, while Wolverine and Sabretooth rush to rescue the others. They find Tyger Tiger and Jessica Drew holding their own, but then Viper threatens Sabertooth with an envenomed blade. Shadowcat comes to, having been only temporarily poisoned by Viper, and phases herself and her allies through the floor and off the vessel.

Some time later, after the Viper has been instated as the island's ruling hand, Wolverine and Shadowcat discuss their adventure. The three are themselves again, but Wolverine muses that, for the first time, Sabretooth is dealing with the memory of having a conscience, and it will probably drive him crazy. Finally, with Viper having put prices on Wolverine and Shadowcat's heads, they decide it's time to depart Madripoor.
name: Green for Death

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
Wolverine resumes his quest of self-rediscovery to determine just what it is he "is the best at" and to help him clear his mind, sorting through recent events. He treks solo through the woods of northern Canada, finding himself drawn to the abandoned Weapon X facility where he was experimented upon years earlier.

Meanwhile, miles to the north, a Wendigo stalks the forest and the spirit that inhabits the creature senses the return of a familiar enemy. It howls and then heads south.

Although the Weapon X facility is deserted, intrusion detection systems are still active and being monitored by the Canadian military. Wolverine sneaks past these safeguards to enter the building. Soon, he comes upon the tank he had once been immersed within. As he recalls the tortures he'd suffered there, the Wendigo bursts in through the wall to viciously attack him. Caught nearly completely by surprise, Wolverine suffers severe wounds before he is able to fight back, but the monster continues to maul him.

Seeking respite, Wolverine ducks into the basement level. He tries to tend to his wounds, binding his injuries with a flag he finds. He also discovers a Hummer which he climbs into and guns through a closed garage door. He slams into the Wendigo, but the swift creature leaps onto the vehicle's roof, trying to smash through it. The assault forces Wolverine to crash and he is thrown from the Hummer.

The Wendigo sets upon him again, grasping him in a bone-crushing bear hug. Although his claws have not yet fully healed since Sabretooth snapped them off, Wolverine extends the stubs and rakes the Wendigo's face. The creature runs off into the woods, howling in pain, while Wolverine succumbs to his grievous injuries and collapses.
name: Survival Of The Fittest Part 1: Whatever it Takes...

description:
In the barn on the North Battleford, Saskatchewan, farm of Jim Jarman, his son, Tommy and Tommy's dog, Jake, discover the badly mauled body of Wolverine, lying unconscious. The boy watches over him for a time, until he comes to, trying to croak out a request for water. But the frightened boy runs away, and Wolverine passes out again.

When he awakens, he finds food and water left for him. As he feeds himself, he recalls the savage attack of the Wendigo that left him in this condition. He also remembers what may be a significant detail: two of the fingers on the Wendigo's left hand were missing.

Miles to the northwest, the Wendigo licks the wounds Wolverine gave it as he defended himself. It also ponders its missing fingers, and a dim memory of its former life as a human. He had been a school headmaster in Wisconsin chopping firewood in the forest when the ground beneath him collapsed. He had found himself pinned under the log and his two fingers severed by his axe.

Back at the farm, Tommy is becoming bolder, bringing Logan more food, first aid supplies, and a kerosene heater, while keeping his presence a secret from his family. Befriending the boy, Logan tells Tommy about himself and the X-Men, about the unjustified prejudice against mutants and about how sometimes one may have to do terrible things in order to survive.

Approaching from the northwest, the Wendigo again stalks Wolverine, following his trail. Again, the memories flicker in its mind; the man had spent days in the sinkhole, his hunger so great, he resorted to consuming his own fingers. This cannibalism triggered the northwoods curse of the Wendigo, dooming him to an existence as the vicious creature.

Wolverine's healing factor has made him nearly whole again, and, realizing the Wendigo will probably come after him, he departs, leaving a goodbye note for Tommy in the barn. Some distance away, Wolverine abruptly stops in his tracks, realizing his foolish move: with Wolverine's scent in the barn, Tommy and his family are in serious danger.

The creature does indeed reach the farm, and Tommy, who had come to bring Logan more kerosene, is now hiding with his dog in the crawlspace beneath the barn. The Wendigo sniffs around the barn, while Tommy tries to keep Jake from barking. Desperately, Tommy grips his struggling dog tighter, begging him in whispers to keep quiet.

At the moment the Wendigo pinpoints Tommy's location, Wolverine leaps onto the monster's back and draws its attention away from the boy. Knowing he's in no condition to battle the beast, Wolverine douses it with kerosene. The Wendigo upends the heater, setting the barn on fire. Wolverine gathers Tommy into his arms as the Wendigo lunges at him. Wolverine grabs an axe off the wall and slashes the beast's face. Injured and aflame, it runs off into the woods.

Wolverine carries Tommy back toward the farmhouse, an empty dog collar gripped in the boy's hand.
name: Survival of the Fittest, Part Two - ...To Survive!

description:
Logan (Wolverine) stands outside the morgue of a Westchester County hospital, eavesdropping on two police officers, Cowaher and Dunleavy, discussing the death of a local woman, Linda Higgins. Dunleavy points out a large welt on the woman's back.

In the waiting room, a doctor delivers the news to Linda's sister and brother-in-law, Michelle and John Kole. He further informs them Linda's daughter, Jane, is in critical condition, suffering from head trauma. Michelle blames Linda's husband.

Logan gets on his motorcycle and heads to the Higgins household, not far from Xavier's school, recalling his previous encounters with the abusive man and regretting he didn't permanently stop him before the inevitable happened. There, Logan sneaks past the police stake-out to examine the crime scene, noting footprints, oil stains on the driveway and an empty beer can. Trusting his instincts, he follows a trail of oil and cans down the highway.

Farther ahead, in a motel for the night before heading to Albany to catch a flight to Canada, Higgins begins to lose patience with his sobbing son Richie. He tells the boy to stop crying and accept what's happened.

Cowaher and Dunleavy consult a retired coroner for his assessment of Linda's injuries, and he surmises the welt came from a shovel or similar object. The officers contact the stake-out team to look for a shovel, which they find and secure.

The next morning, Richie asks to use the bathroom before he and his dad leave for Albany. After checking to make sure his son didn't leave any clues behind, they drive off.

Logan checks a series of motels along the trail, finally finding the one Higgins stayed at. After the maid tells him they left about a half an hour prior, Logan finds Richie's message, scrawled in crayon on the back of the bathroom door: "Albinee airport 9:00".

At the police station, Cowaher and Dunleavy run the fingerprints on the shovel handle against Higgins' filed prints, but come up negative. Then, on a hunch, they pull up the local school system's child fingerprint database to look at Richie's.

Higgins' daughter Jane wakes up in the hospital much improved and asks her aunt and uncle about Linda and Richie. When John replies that her father took Richie away, she asks if it's because Richie hurt their mother. Meanwhile, the police confirm the prints on the shovel match Richie's.

At the Albany Airport, Logan seizes Higgins from behind, intending to turn him in to the police. Upon seeing Logan, Richie shouts out that he himself killed his mother. Higgins relates what had happened: arriving at home partially drunk, he struck Linda, who then grabbed a gun from his car and threatened to shoot him. In desperation, Richie hit his mother in the back with a shovel, causing her to fall forward against the porch steps with Jane between her body and the ground. The impact broke her neck and injured Jane's head.

Still holding Higgins responsible for the whole affair, Logan detains him until the police arrive to take him and Richie into custody.
name: A Rage In The Cage

description:
A night at the bar turns ugly! Logan has to face off with an unstable mutant powerhouse, and even he might be in over his head! Good thing he's got help from Carol Danvers, a.k.a. WARBIRD!

Story opens with an alien escaping a prison planet and stealing an alien craft. The following scene shows Wolverine and Carol Danver in civilian clothes at the local bar playing a game of pool for drinks. Both Wolverine and Carol Danver reminisce their old adventures while playing the news reports show unknown mutant called Powerhouse who is rampaging through a U.N. building angry over the coming mutant summit discussion.

Wolverine hoping to prevent anymore mutant hostility leaves the bar changing into his uniform but stopped by Carol who wishes to go with him, Wolverine unwilling to go with her due to her still being drunk. Carol Danver convinces Wolverine to let her come along and flies Wolverine to the U.N. Building, still drunk Warbird drops Wolverine too early forcing Wolverine to engage powerhouse as he lands on top of her. Immediately engaging Powerhouse, Warbird begins to indiscriminately throw energy blast at Powerhouse who is still fighting Wolverine.

Wolverine is now forced to not only evade Powerhouse attacks but also Warbird who is drunk and causing just as much collateral damage as the person they are suppose to stop. Wolverine has to decide who is the bigger danger but thankfully the decision is taken from when Warbird decides to fistfight Powerhouse and is immediately knocked out due to being heavily drunk. Wolverine runs in to rescue Warbird and manages to knockout Powerhouse.

During the mist of battle an alien craft crash lands and possesses one of the curious human's who looked inside the crater blocks away from the battle. While Wolverine walks to check up on the unconscious Warbird a car comes barreling in and coming to a stop. Wolverine goes to investigate the situation and the slump over driver and is immediately possessed by the alien life form.
name: The Great Escape Part 1 of 6 - Losing Control

description: WOLVERINE VS. THE MARVEL UNIVERSE! Featuring too many guest stars to name!
name: The Great Escape Part 2 of 6 - Choice In The Matter

description: Trapped on PRISON WORLD! Light years from home with no way out, Logan's only option is to fight for his life!
name: The Great Escape Part 3 of 6 - From Bad To Worse

description: Prison-break, Wolverine style! But can even Logan escape the clutches of the cosmic being known as the Collector?
name: The Great Escape Part 4 - Trust

description: Wolverine vs. the STARJAMMERS! Plus: The secret origin - and shocking secret - of Prison World!
name: The Great Escape Part 5 of 6 - Countdown To Destruction

description:
GALACTUS HAS COME! The Devourer of Worlds has his sights set on Prison World, which means only one thing: Wolverine is about to become cosmic lunch!

Wolverine was possessed by an alien astral projection which inhabited his body in order to take it back the alien prison world ran by the collector. Logan didnt want to go at 1st but when he saw the size of the prison world and the Collectors guards he decided to help them break free. the problem was that the planet held the last survivors of their planets after Galactus feeding, The prison world had a stealth force field to keep Galactus from locating the prison world. Wolverine ninja stealth through the prison world and located the power core and turned it off even managing to take down and evade the collectors guards. Once he deactivated the power core the prisoners revolted against the guards as they began to evacuate the prison planet. The problem was that there was not enough ships for all of them and not all the prisoners were leaving as they were also attacking the guards. To Wolverine's horror Galactus appeared as he began to prepare to consume the prison planet, The Collector and Uroc inform Wolverine of the real purpose for the prison planet and how bad wolverine screwed up. Wolverine along with Uroc and the few remaining guards try to organize the evacuation while also stalling Galactus by attacking him with alien fighter ships, Galactus of course ignores their attacks only occasionally firing them out of the sky with a look and an energy blast. Wolverine heads to Galactus elemental converter in hopes of destroying it and stalling Galactus if only for a few precious moments, the problem arises when Wolverine's bone claws keep shattering upon the alien metal. Wolverine comes to a horrible realization that it is all his fault and that let the whole planet down because he kept running around as if he had adamantium still which will now cost the aliens their lives, Uroc arrives during Wolverines self doubt to help him destroy the elemental converter.The alien girl that had initially possessed Wolverine decides to try and possess Galactus and jumps out of the ship and parachutes in front of Galactus locking eyes with him. To everyones surprise it appears it is working as both beings are entranced with each other but suddenly Galactus reacts and causes a psychic feed back which hurts the alien girl and knocking her out. Wolverine manages to catch her as they make their escape in the last spaceship leaving Uroc to destroy the elemental converter and buy them time to get off planet. Wolverine realizes as they escape that the alien girl is not just unconscious but comatose and looking back at the planet as they leave into space he sees Galactus feeding off the planet causing him even more pain an vanquish holding himself responsible for the death of an entire planet and various races.
name: The Great Escape Part 6 of 6 - Doomsday!

description: No matter how hard he tries, Wolverine just can't escape trouble! Between fighting genetic abominations and mad scientists, Logan has only one question: can't a guy have a drink in peace? Guest-starring Cable!
name: The Freaks Come Out At Night

description: The hunt is on! Logan's seemingly tracked down Magneto, and he'll stop at nothing to get to him! And with his fellow X-Man Nightcrawler at his side, there's sure to be a fight waiting for them!
name: Vengeance

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Something bizarre occurred when the X-Men returned from space last month... something that has created mistrust amongst the team. Now Wolverine finds himself hunted by someone he¹s long counted on as an ally, and caught in a conflict that will result in the death of one of them!
name: Broken Dreams

description: Because the fans demanded it, Alpha Flight returns! The X-Men are no more, what¹s a poor canucklehead to do? How about a return trip to visit his roots?namely, the Canadian super-team called Alpha Flight?! Too bad Logan gets caught in the middle of their current mission, which is to capture the rogue Weapon X known as Kane!
name: Reunion!

description: Guest-starring Alpha Flight! The two Guardians have been abducted, and more than their lives hang in the balance! Who are the mysterious ³techno-cult² behind the heroes¹ disappearance?and what profane interest do they have in Snowbird? With Wolverine¹s former teammates on hand it¹s a time for old friendships to be renewed, old rivalries to be sparked... and new enemies to be made!
name: Rebirth - Loose Ends

description: On the eve of the Time of Darkness, enter the Leader! Take one feral X-Man, add one immortal Avenger, throw in a megalomaniacal genius and you've got a throwdown of epic proportions! Hercules guest stars as Wolverine is confronted by the evil of the Leader! Could this be a prelude to next month's 20th Anniversary?
name: First Cut!

description:
The X-Men learn that the man they thought was Wolverine is actually a Skrull. But if that is true, then where is the real Logan?

Wolverine gets kiddnapped by Apocalypse, and forced to battle Sabretooth. Who ever wins the battle becomes the new Horseman of War. Since Wolverine thinks he can get free from Apocalypse's mind control, he defeats Sabretooth, than becomes the Horseman of War and gets Sabretooth's adamantium skeleton and he battles the Hulk.

Summary

After the X-Men learn that the man they thought was Wolveerine was nothing more than a skrull imposter, it is learned how it occured. After their mission to a training ground for the skrulls in space, Wolverine was abducted by the skrulls and taken to their master. There he pitted Sabretooth, and Wolverine against each other for the right to become the new horsemen of death. Even though Wolverine is facing a larger, stronger opponet with his bone claws versus an adamantium skeleton, Wolverine determines that Sabretooth would be a merciless killer while he could beat the programming. After winning, he is again infused with the adamantium taken from Sabretooth. In the present, Death (in truth Wolverine), takes on the Incredible Hulk. It is a monumental battle, and near the end, he has a chance to kill the green monster. However, he hesitates, and the Hulk is able to punch his foe and rushes off. Once the Hulk departs, Apocalypse teleports Death up to his location and informs him of his new era - the age of Apocalypse!
name: On the Edge of Darkness

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
The X-Men search for Wolverine who has become Death, one of the Horsemen of Apocalypse.

The X-Men faces the Horseman of Death who is now Wolverine. While they battle, Psylocke tries too get Wolverine to break out of Apocalypse's mind control using Cerebro.
name: Apocalypse: The Twelve Part 4 - Through A Dark Tunnel

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
While Logan battles Warren, Psylocke risks freeing the Shadow King.

The X-Men helps Wolverine to shake off Apocalypse's control over him.
name: Apocalypse: The Twelve Part 5 - Into The Light

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Years have passed since CABLE #77 and the world has changed once again. The forces of the High Lord have exacted a horrrible price from the heroes of Earth. Among those martyred: Mr. Fantastic, the Invisible Woman, the Human Torch and the Thing. But the Fantastic Four are not gone! In the place of the original team, a new (but strangely familiar) foursome has gathered: Spider-Man! The Hulk! Ghost Rider! And Wolverine! Together they've defeated all manner of threats, but now they face the ultimate test from a villain they thought long dead!
name: Ages of Apocalypse - Same As It Never Was

description:
The tyrant who twisted Logan into the Horseman of Death is no more, but his effects on Wolverine remain! With his healing factor gone, can Logan survive an internal attack?

A depowered Wolverine goes out for a night patrol, running into a plainclothes Nova at his job a local fast food joint. (Wolverine is without powers due to the actions of High Evolutionary in Uncanny X-Men #379).

Wolverine sneaks into Reanimator's warehouse, but without his powers he's no match an the army of super robots. Luckily, Nova followed Logan, and speedily returns with the rest of the New Warriors in tow. As a team they make quick work of the Reanimator's robot army – he's unable to replenish them without his own mutant powers.

The New Warriors turn Reanimator over to the police while Wolverine wanders away into the night.
name: Resurrection

description: "Blood Debt." The next chapter in Wolverine's life starts in this double-sized extravaganza! While old friends return to Wolverine's life, some brand-new, and decidedly vicious, enemies make their move! It's been six months since the war with Apocalypse, the return of his adamantium, the taking of his free will and the heartrending sacrifice. Now, as Logan grapples with the emotional repercussions, a new evil arises that targets his very heart! Who is Lord Haan, and how might his vile bloodline consume Wolverine? Plus: What are Silver Samurai and Yukio doing back in Logan's life?
name: Blood Debt

description: Wolverine is caught in the middle of a blood war, and the first victims are Yukio and Amiko! The mysterious Lord Haan will stop at nothing to destroy his brother, even if it means massacring the Silver Samurai and Logan! If Haan succeeds, he'll unleash a reign of terror the likes of which has not been seen for centuries... but Wolverine's only hope to stop him will carry its own terrible price!
name: Blood Debt Part 2

description: In an ancient stronghold between the Gobi Desert and the Great Wall of China, Wolverine is caught squarely in the middle of a war between Lord Haan, his brother Gom, and Clan Yashida! At stake: the lives of thousands of innocents—including Yukio and Amiko!
name: Blood Debt Part 3

description: It's mayhem in the Far East, as Wolverine faces a desperately murderous Lord Haan in a final showdown! But what stakes does Haan's sister Kia hold in the outcome? In other words, even if Logan defeats Haan, will he merely trade in one evil for another? Expect about 10,000 shell casings, 20,000 shards of broken glass, and even a little romance too, in this all-out action extravaganza from writer/artist Steve Skroce!
name: Blood Debt Conclusion!

description:
ALL ALONG THE WATCHTOWER PART 1

Deadpool accepts a hit from a mysterious bidder called the Watchtower. His intended target? Wolverine! There’s a bounty on Logan’s head, and Deadpool plans to collect! But will the Watchtower prove too morally questionable for even the Merc? Featuring the script and art of comic legend Rob Liefeld!
name: All Along The Watchtower Part 1

description:
ALL ALONG THE WATCHTOWER PART 2

The Watchtower is revealed to be a group of overzealous techies with a bloodlust for mutants. But that doesn’t mean they aren’t dangerous. At risk of becoming a “martyr”, can Wolverine spring his fellow prisoners from the sudden call of death? And will Deadpool prove ally or foe? Guest-starring X-woman Siryn!
name: All Along The Watchtower Part 2

description:
Wolverine, Spiderman and Tara Curson( NYPD Lieutenant ) have arrived in the abandoned tunnels to track down a murderer. They run into Mole Man and his team of Subterraneans. Wolverine puts the blame on Mole Man and launches an attack.

Mole Man orders his subterraneans to subdue Spiderman and Tara. He then attacks wolverine, saying that people underestimate him by virtue of his size. Mole Man doesn’t give wolverine a chance to counter-attack, and uses his stick to keep him at bay. The subterraneans manage to take down Spiderman and Tara but only temporarily. Spiderman shakes them off while blasts them with her handgun. But suddenly, a bigger Subterranean catches hold of Tara. She screams out for help. Quite surprisingly, Mole Man comes to her aid. He knocks out the beast with a jolt of electricity and saves her. Then he orders his forces to end the conflict and prepares to talk to the heroes.

Mole Man asks the group why they have come down into his kingdom. Tara says that they are here to arrest him for murdering innocent people. Mole Man assures them that though his ultimate goal is world dominion, he has no intention of murdering innocents. He speaks of a greater danger which spells doom for his kingdom and the surface world alike. He says that these murderers are surface-dwellers and are aided by monstrous beasts and advanced weaponry. They too have taken refuge in the abandoned tunnels. Wolverine strikes a deal with Mole Man, telling him that he could lead them to these murderers and Wolverine’s group would leave his kingdom without a word. Mole Man agrees.

Mole Man takes them deeper into the tunnels and stops at a place, saying that they have arrived in the marauders’ area. With that he leaves. Wolverine’s group is suddenly surrounded by Morlocks, who hold hostage and tell the other two to accompany them peacefully. They meet a man named Carver, who says that they won’t leave ever again. Tara flashes out her gun but is knocked down by a morlock. Spiderman launches an attack on Carver but fails, while Wolverine is clobbered by a giant beast. Carver says that this beast named Fugue is behind all the murders, though unintentionally. Wolverine challenges him to a duel.

They start upon a rock outcrop surrounded by lava. Carver launches a sudden attack. Wolverine’s admantium claws have no effect on Carver’s hard skin. Abruptly, Carver flashes two claws on his hands and teies to throw wolverine over the edge. But Wolverine strikes his eye. Fugue sees his master’s plight and jumps towards Wolverine, but is knocked down with a mighty blow. Spiderman manages to web him from falling into the pit. A sudden earthquake shakes both the duelers off the ground. Carver manages to hold Wolverine’s feet but slips, taking Fugue with him. Mole Man comes out and guides the group out of the place, just before a massive landslide occurs.

Wolverine says that he isn’t sure whether Carver yet lives but adds that Tara should complete her investigation.
name: Going Underground

description: The only thing standing between a legion of the Mole Man's subterranean creatures and the unwitting populace of New York City is the unlikely duo of Wolverine and Spider-Man! But what is the greater threat that looms over both sides?
name: Right Underneath It

description: Who is Mr. X, and why does he want to kill Wolverine? You've heard the question posed before, but in this case the answer will shock you... and the villain will repulse you!
name: The Best There Is Part 1

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: While Wolverine battles his way through the homicidal duo known as the Lady Killers, the man known only as Mr. X watches... and waits. Plus: Sabretooth is betrayed by someone close to him, someone who is also gunning for Logan!
name: The Best There Is Part 2 Of 3

description: The final confrontation with Mr. X! How can Wolverine defeat an enemy who anticipates his every move? How can Logan beat a foe that revels in spilled blood, both his own and others'? Plus: Sabretooth strikes a deal with an old acquaitance...but who?
name: The Best There Is Part 3 Of 3

description: Logan becomes Public Enemy #1 when he sees his face plastered across every TV screen in the nation, as an accused murderer! Plus: Sabretooth receives an ominous offer from an acquaintance both he and Wolverine hoped they'd never see again!
name: The Hunted Part 1

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning
New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning
New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: The Beast guest stars... as he and Wolverine run from the law! Whether Logan commited the crime he's accused of isn't the problem. The problem is the Shivers Man, a mystery man dedicated to bringing in Wolverine and the Beast, dead or alive! Plus: Nick Fury!
name: The Hunted Part 2

description: Guest-starring the Beast! Accused of a crime he didn't commit, Wolverine unlocks "The Cage." But is it a person, place or thing? The answer may shock you... but not as much as it will Logan!
name: The Hunted Part 3

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description: Prelude to Wolverine: The Origin. Wolverine discovers the person who's been pulling the strings, and now he's going to cut them! Appearances by Mr. Shivers and Nick Fury. First appearances by Wolverine: the Origin characters in flashback panel. Plus: a special five-page section by Mr. WEAPON X himself, Barry Windsor-Smith!
name: The Hunted Conclusion

first_appearance_locations.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

location_credits.name: New Charles Xavier School for Mutants

description:
Wolverine returns to Madripoor, and right into the dangerous arms of his villainous "wife" Viper! What villain has lured Logan back to his old stomping grounds, and into the battle-to-the-death tournament known as Blood Sport?

Wolverine, with the help of Nick Fury, has made the murder rap of killing Senator Drexel Walsh go away. Soon after the X-man receives a letter from a mysterious "friend' urging him to fly to Madripoor and compete in something called The Bloodsport Contest. Not one to shy away from a mystery, Wolverine dons the persona of Patch and flies to his former home. While on the plane Wolverine sees a demons face in the clouds, but brushes off as the effects of losing sleep.

Once in Madripoor, Wolverine is contacted by Jae Lo, his personal assistant to The Bloodsport Contest. Jae Lo then takes Wolverine to the Princess Bar, to meet with the head of the contest. Wolverine surprised to see that the head of the contest is Viper. Wolverine believes she is the "friend" that asked him to enter the contest, but she convinces him other wise.

Viper then explains to Wolverine the rules of The Bloodsport Contest, and Wolverine watches the first round matches.

  • Headhunter vs Oddball- Winner Headhunter
  • Gamecock vs Puma- Winner Puma
  • Cat vs Taskmaster- Winner Taskmaster
  • Zaran vs Razorfist- Winner Zaran
  • Anaconda vs Forearm- Winner Anaconda
  • Eel vs Toad- Winner Toad

Then its Wolverines turn to face Speed Demon. Wolverine is able to defeat the speedster, but does not kill him like the crowd wants.

Then round two takes place.

  • Taskmaster vs Zaran- Winner Taskmaster
  • Anaconda vs Puma- Winner Puma
  • Wolverine vs Toad- Winner Wolverine

Then Wolverine gets to watch Headhunter face the Champ, and he learns that his "friend" the Champ is really Mister X.
name: Bloodsport Part 1 Of 3

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description:
Notes:

  • Continues from Part I: Detective Comics Annual #1 - Fables, Part 1: The Monkey Trap.
  • Concludes in Part III: The Question Annual #1 - Fables Part 3.
  • "Very special thanks to Marfran McFarland and Edward Summer."
  • "Publishorial" 2/3 page text piece by Jenette Kahn.
  • "DC Checklist This Week" 1/3 page featuring the comics being released.
name: Lessons for a Crab

description:
1. "Saving Face"

Green Arrow sees Adolph Clevenger, a man he got a tip may be killed soon, fall from a window, dead. While trying to follow the killer sees a man he recognizes, the Question. But Vic Sage isn't a killer... is he?

Green Arrow travels to Hub City and finds out there have been a lot of people dressing as the Question. He follows a lead to a Caribbean island-- Santa Prisca. Ollie then uncovers and stops a plot by Juarez, saving Hub City's citizens.

2. "Do Black Canaries Sing?"

While Ollie is away in Santa Prisca Dinah wakes from a nightmare by the shattering of a window. It is Dinah's mother who broke the window. Then Dinah's mother purse gets stolen and she begins tracking the thief & Dinah helps. Dinah sees the boy return to his house, where he has several sibling and his mom, who are all quite poor. Dinah goes in to get the purse, and tells the mother she is the boys employer, and says she will see him next Saturday at 9. And the boy gives the purse back.

The next morning Dinah's mother tries to persuade Dinah to give up being a hero because she has lost her canary cry, Dinah refuses to give up just because of that.

Notes:

  • "With Johnny DC" 2/3 page text piece featuring news and tidbits in the DC Universe.
  • "DC Checklist This Week" 1/3 page featuring the weeks upcoming releases.
  • "Saving Face" written by Dennis O'Neil, penciled by Ed Hannigan, inked by Dick Giordano and Frank McLaughlin, colored by Julia Lacquement and lettered by John Costanza.
  • "Do Black Canaries Sing?" written by Sarah Byam, penciled by Dick Giordano, inked by Joe Rubinstein, colored by Julia Lacquement and lettered by Steve Haynie.
  • "A Brief History of Green Arrow" a page and a half text piece by Mike Gold.
  • Who's Who Entries:
  • "Green Arrow" penciled by Dan Jurgens and inked by Dick Giordano.
  • "Black Canary" (Dinah Laurel Lance) penciled and inked by Randy Duburke.
  • "Shado" penciled and inked by Michael Davis.
  • "James Cameron" penciled and inked by Bove.
  • "Speedy" penciled and inked by Grant Miehm.
  • "Black Canary" (Dinah Drake Lance) penciled and inked by Rick Stasi.
name: Saving Face / Do Black Canaries Sing?

description:
A drug lord in the Amazon tired of Green Arrow destroying his shipments. His dying mother (and his partner) suggested he hire the man, then kill him.

Ollie and Vic Sage, his house guest, returned to Sherwood Florist. Dinah gave him a package that had arrived. In it was a video tape and a $1000. The man on the tape asked him to partake on a mission.

The group ( Ollie, Dinah, Vic and Jackie (Connely) Fermin - Myra's child) arrived at their destination and spoke with their host, Mr. Lacquer. He told them that his dying mother was named for a very rare flower and she wanted to see one more before she died. He gave them directions on where they might come across this rare find.

Ollie and Dinah went out, Vic and Jackie stayed behind. They were captured by Lacquer's rivals. They were taken to the leader, Christopher. He told them the real story behind the Lacquers - they were drug dealers and slavers.

Lacquer had Vic beaten and taken outside, Jackie would be sold. Vic was able to escape and get back to his friends. They made a plan and headed back in to save Jackie. They were successful. Vic decided he would stay there with Jackie to make a new life while Ollie and Dinah returned to Seattle.

Lacquer killed himself and his overbearing mother using her oxygen tank as an explosive.

Notes:

  • "Focus" 2/3 page text piece featuring a brief synopsis of the upcoming annuals being released from June till December.
  • "DC Checklist This Week" 1/3 page text piece featuring the comics being released for the week.
name: A Walk in the Wind
Eclipso: The Darkness Within

description: Tagline: "Bloodlines: Earthplague". A military veteran is terrorized by an alien being.
name: Lust Be A Lady Tonight

description: A retelling of Green Arrow's transformation from a playboy millionaire to a vigilante.
name: Year One

description: Seattle is coming apart, and only one hero can hold it together. Dinah Lance is forced to relive her own origin while investigating a rash of homicides. This leads her into a confrontation with an underworld mastermind whose latest scheme has gone out of control. It becomes a race against time that Black Canary must win before more people die.
name: Hero Worship Part 1

description: Black Canary struggles with her identity as a crimefighter and her relationship with Ollie after his absence for a year. Meanwhile, she is out to help a street girl named Sally and stop whoever is poisoning Seattle citizens.
name: Hero Worship Part 2

description: Black Canary is in an all-out fight to the finish with an assassin called Klik in order to save a street girl named Sally. But Klik is working for somebody, and he isn't saying who, so it seems that Black Canary's work on this has just begun.
name: Hero Worship Part 3

description: Whorrsman is back and looking to buy up a lot of land. But some of Black Canary's neighborhood friends are standing in his way. Black Canary is racing to get to the bottom of the gentrification in the neighborhood, but there is problems for her friend, Mr. Cinchelli the shoemaker, and Dinah may not be in time to stop it.
name: The Art of Whorr

description: Black Canary, Gan and two FBI agents track an electrifying killer bent on avenging the murder of his family.
name: Dance of the Capoeira!

description: On the trail of a mob informer, Black Canary heads from Seattle to Philadelphia, where the Ray appears on the scene when Black Canary is knocked out by the informant. Black Canary needs to rush back to Seattle to catch the informant, but the Ray's presence complicates matters when Ollie shows up.
name: The Fish

description: Part 3 of 3. Nightwing and the Huntress try to rescue Black Canary even as Dinah Lance battles her would-be enslaver, Symitar.
name: Free the Prisoners

description: Dinah meets a man from her mother's past, Jack Lynch, one connected to a man bent on mass murder, with gene-spliced beasts. Dinah also opens her home to Symitar's women, but the man after Jack Lynch may just get Sherwood Florist caught in the crossfire.
name: Canary's Grave

description:
A Zero Month crossover issue. After the events of Zero Hour, Oliver Queen has decided to give up being Green Arrow. He puts all of his things in storage, and returns to the monastery run by Master Jansen. He seeks to clear his mind and his conscious. Once there, he meets Connor Hawke, a fellow monk who secretly idolizes Green Arrow. After giving Ollie a birthday present, Connor asks Oliver to teach him how to shoot a bow. Ollie teaches Connor archery, while Connor teaches Ollie martial arts. Two freelance mercenaries come to the monastery, intent on killing Oliver Queen. They take their shot, but Ollie defeats them, with Connor’s help. Content with who he is, Ollie is ready to leave the monastery. Connor asks to come with him into the world, and Ollie agrees.

Notes:

  • On page 6 panel 1 Vincenzo Pizza is a homage to assistant editor Darren Vincenzo.
name: Cast Upon the Waters

description:
Where Angels Fear To Tread, Part 1 of 5.

Conner and Eddie Fyers start out on a quest to find Oliver Queen who was snatched by Hal Jordan who rescued him from the NSA. Oliver quickly finds out that he's clearly crazy as he was talking about the times they were going to find America. Ollie quickly stops Hal by arguing with him that he's changed and Hal's dead. Hal reveals that Conner is Oliver's son and shocks Oliver. Oliver makes a final point leaves, Hal is revealed in wearing his Parallax armour and teleports away. Oliver finds a pub and discusses his troubles with the bartender who tells him to that he's paying for it.
name: The Ring and the Arrow

description: Ollie joins Eden Corps and Arsenal helps Eddie and Connor track down Ollie.
name: In Like Flynn

description: Eden Corps begins their plans for destroying man-made structures with Ollie's help.
name: In the Lurch

description:
Where Angels Fear to Trend, Part Four of Five:

Hyrax brings Oliver to a wheat field to discuss her plans for Metropolis. He objects but goes in the armed airplane for it. Connor and Eddie stalls in the parking lot of the the NSA HQ waiting for a chance to get answers for Ollie's location which they did and Camorouge as an ally. Ollie is on the plane when a NSA agent blows him and Ollie's cover, shoots him and have Ollie's hand in a deadman switch. Just as the plane flies, with a stuck Ollie on, Connor and his team arrives at the scene which proceeds to tail Ollie's plane. Superman quickly arrives on the plane and tries to save Ollie and his city but the only option to save both OIlie and Metropolis is for him ]to cut Ollie's arm...

Notes:

  • 48 page issue.
  • "Chapter One: The Plastic Eater" penciled by Jim Aparo and inked by Gerry Fernandez.
  • "Chapter Two: Reliable Sources" penciled by Rodolfo Damaggio, inked by Robert Campanella.
  • "Chapter Three: To Save the Day" penciled by Jim Aparo and inked by Gerry Fernandez.
  • Green Arrows (Oliver Queen and Conner Hawke) pinup penciled by Dan Norton, inked by Scott Hanna and colored by Matt Hollingsworth.
  • Green Arrow and Superman pinup penciled by Rodolfo Damaggio, inked by Robert Campanella and colored by Matt Hollingsworth.
name: The Trap

description: As Green Arrow uncovered Hyrax's plan to raze the city of Metropolis, he realized he had to take a stance against this environmental extremist. On board a plane with a powerful bomb set to destroy Metropolis, Green Arrow activated a dead man's switch, giving him a choice; he could lose his arm to escape the inevitable explosion, or lose his life altogether. In the end, Oliver Queen chose death, leaving his friends and fellow heroes to grieve for him and paving the way for Connor to take his place as the new Green Arrow.
name: Run of the Arrow

description: Connor decides to try and fight for the ashram again. This time he fights against Seljuk, who Mueller has chosen to represent him in combat. Connor is able to win and reclaim the ashram for Master Jansen. He and Eddie decide to spend time there as students.
name: Full Circle

description: A DC ONE MILLION tie-in! On the unspoiled planet Earth in the 853rd Century live a band of forest-dwellers known as the Green Arrows. Descendants of Oliver Queen, Connor Hawke, Dinah Lance and Roy Harper, they live a tranquil existence--at least until their realm is invaded by Groddchild!
name: All Down The Years

description: Shado is one woman against the Yakuza. Her life and that of her child, Green Arrow's child, is on the line. Shado, the woman warrior, was introduced in the miniseries GREEN ARROW: THE LONGBOW HUNTERS and has been an integral part of the ongoing GREEN ARROW series. Now, she's the center of the action! Green Arrow appears in flashbacks of this miniseries, tying it to the continuity of the regular series and adding to the complexity of the relationship between Shado and Oliver Queen. It is the ruthless Japanese crime syndicate that Shado must fight, with an ancient and deadly sword at the heart of the combat. The sword, a tremendous symbol of power, is brought to Shado by a World War II veteran who wants to return it to its rightful owner. The Yakuza claim the weapon, and they will stop at nothing to get it. Shado is driven to help the old soldier, and the two confront danger at every step.
name: Souvenirs

description: While helping a guilt-ridden American G.I. return a samurai sword he took as a World War II souvenir, Shado finds herself in the middle of a modern day war between factions of the deadly Yakuza.
name: A Force of Dragons

description: With the Yakuza putting all its efforts into the search for the sword of the dragon, only Shado, backed by her motley band of fighters, can keep the sword from falling into the wrong hands.
name: A Force of Dragons

description: The sword of the dragon is up for grabs as Shado and her crew confront the Yakuza in a final deadly showdown.
name: The Black Dragon

description:
Features Include:
Torpedoes Away
Invincible City
Battle-Wagon!
Shanghaied!
Shipwrecked!
Navy Jet
name: Torpedoes Away!

description:
Features Include:
Dreadnought!
Target ... on the Nose
One Hour to Live!
Alone
Sailors Aren't Santa Clauses!
Beached!
name: Dreadnought!
